content.question: A fair six-sided die, with sides numbered 1 through 6, will be rolled a total of 15 times. Let <math alttext="x bar sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the average of the first ten rolls, and let <math alttext="x bar sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the average of the remaining five rolls. What is the mean <math alttext="mu subscript, x bar sub 1 minus x bar sub 2, end subscript" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> of the sampling distribution of the difference in sample means <math alttext="x bar sub 1 minus x bar sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction 3.5 over 10, end fraction, minus the fraction 3.5 over 5, equals negative 0.35" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3.5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3.5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.35</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="10 times 3.5, minus 5 times 3.5, equals 17.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>3.5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>3.5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>17.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="6 times, open parenthesis 10 minus 5, close parenthesis, equals 30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 5.8: Sampling Distributions for Differences in Sample Means

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
